trigger.name: Unexpected BIOS firmware version (mini-IPMI)

item.name: All motherboard sensors maximum temperature
item.description: Among all cards and its cores.

item.name: CPU temperature configuration status
item.description:
In some cases it could also mean GPU temperature, system voltage and fan speed.
Could refer to mini_ipmi_lmsensors.py, mini_ipmi_ohmr.py or mini_ipmi_bsdcpu.py.

trigger.name: CPU binary was not found in PATH or manually (mini-IPMI)
No CPUs were found for temperature test (mini-IPMI)
No GPUs were found for temperature test (mini-IPMI)
No temperatures were found among CPUs (mini-IPMI)
No temperatures were found among GPUs (mini-IPMI)
Something went wrong with CPU configuration (mini-IPMI)
trigger.description: Ensure you configuration is up to date and please report: https://github.com/nobodysu/zabbix-mini-IPMI/issues

trigger.name: Template is assigned, but no CPU data recieved (mini-IPMI)
Something went wrong with CPU sending (mini-IPMI)
Too much data for CPU sending (mini-IPMI)

item.name: All CPUs maximum temperature
item.description: Among all processors and its cores.

trigger.name: CPU temperature is too high (over {$CPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
CPU temperature was too high in past 24 hours (over {$CPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
No DISKs were found for temperature test (mini-IPMI)
No temperatures were found among DISKs (mini-IPMI)
smartctl was not found in PATH or manually (mini-IPMI)
Something went wrong with DISK configuration (mini-IPMI)
trigger.description: Ensure you configuration is up to date and please report: https://github.com/nobodysu/zabbix-mini-IPMI/issues

trigger.name: Template is assigned, but no DISK data recieved (mini-IPMI)
Something went wrong with DISK sending (mini-IPMI)
Too much data for DISK sending (mini-IPMI)
DISK temperature is too high
DISK temperature was too high in past 24 hours

item.name: All GPUs maximum temperature
item.description: Among all cards and its cores.

trigger.name: Unexpected OHMR version

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: Update interval MUST be higher than 60 seconds!

trigger_prototype.name: {#BOARD_TEMP}: board temperature is too high (over {$BOARD.HIGH.TEMP} C)
{#BOARD_TEMP}: board temperature was too high within past 24 hours (over {$BOARD.HIGH.TEMP} C)
{#P5V}: voltage is too high
{#P5V}: voltage is too low
{#P5V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P5V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#P12V}: voltage is too high
{#P12V}: voltage is too low
{#P12V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P12V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#P33V}: voltage is too high
{#P33V}: voltage is too low
{#P33V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#P33V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#VBAT}: CMOS battery voltage is too low
{#VCC3V}: voltage is too high
{#VCC3V}: voltage is too low
{#VCC3V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#VCC3V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
{#VSB3V}: voltage is too high
{#VSB3V}: voltage is too low
{#VSB3V}: voltage was too high within past 24 hours
{#VSB3V}: voltage was too low within past 24 hours
cpu{#CPU}: no temperature sensor was found on CPU
cpu{#CPU}: CPU model had changed
cpu{#CPU}: temperature is too high (over {$CPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
cpu{#CPU}: temperature was too high within past 24 hours (over {$CPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
{#FAN_NAME}: fan speed is too low (below {$FAN.MIN.RPM} RPM)
gpu{#GPUFAN}: fan speed is too low (below {$GPU.FAN.MIN.RPM} RPM)
gpu{#GPU}: no fan info was found on GPU
gpu{#GPU}: no temperature info was found on GPU
gpu{#GPU}: GPU model had changed
gpu{#GPUMEM}: free video memory is too low (below {$GPU.MIN.MEM.MB} Mb)
gpu{#GPUTEMP}: temperature is too high (over {$GPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
gpu{#GPUTEMP}: temperature was too high within past 24 hours (over {$GPU.HIGH.TEMP} C)
cpu{#CPU}: is throttling right now
cpu{#CPU}: no temperature info was found on CPU
trigger_prototype.description: Take a look at CPUS_WITHOUT_SENSOR variable in the script and please report: https://github.com/nobodysu/zabbix-mini-IPMI/issues

trigger_prototype.name: cpu{#CPU}: was throttled within past 24 hours

discovery_rule.name: DISK discovery
discovery_rule.description: Update interval MUST be higher than 60 seconds!

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Assumed to be a placeholder NVMe (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Command line did not parse (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Device open failed (mini-IPMI)
trigger_prototype.description: Probably no administrative permissions for smartctl or incorrect device name.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Have no temperature sensor
{#DISK}: Is in SLEEP mode (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Is in STANDBY mode (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: No temperature info was found on disk
trigger_prototype.description: Take a look at noTemperatureSensorModels variable in the script and please report: https://github.com/nobodysu/zabbix-mini-IPMI/issues

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Something went wrong (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Timeout exceeded while calling the disk (mini-IPMI)
trigger_prototype.description: Could indicate disk failure. Investigation is advised.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Unknown USB bridge (mini-IPMI)
{#DISK}: Disk temperature is critical
{#DISK}: Disk temperature is too high
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} If last value is more than maximum temperature setting AND previous value is more than maximum temperature setting AND there's been at least 2 values in the last 2 hours AND drive status is not DUPLICATE_IGNORE, STANDBY* or SLEEP.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Disk temperature is too low
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} If last value is less than minimum temperature setting AND previous value is less than minimum temperature setting AND there's been at least 3 values in the last 2 hours AND drive status is not DUPLICATE_IGNORE, STANDBY* or SLEEP.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK}: Disk temperature was critical in the past 24 hours
trigger_prototype.description: If any value within last 24 hours exceeded critical temperature setting and last drive status is not DUPLICATE_IGNORE, STANDBY* or SLEEP.

macro.description: Update interval MUST be higher than 60 seconds!
Update interval MUST be higher than 60 seconds! Intervals less than 20 minutes will cause disk never to spun down.
